alert.note: Alert for Tuscaloosa (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 2:55PM CST until December 16 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene, Pickens, Sumter and Tuscaloosa. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 255 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Union, Gainesville, Emelle, West Greene, New West Greene, Mantua, Panola, Benevola, Knoxville, Jena, Geiger, Pleasant Ridge, New Mount Hebron, Clinton, Lewiston, Warsaw, Snoddy, Sumterville and Ralph.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
